column1: #Text=born Clara Belle Smith ( May 10 , 1889 in Missouri - died August 1 , 1980 Ontario , California with some sources stating she was born 30 January 1879 and dying 13 March 1961 ) [ 1 ] was one of the first costume designers in Hollywood . [ 2 ]
#Text=She did notable work in the films of D.W. Griffith and Cecil B. DeMille .
#Text=Recognising the importance of film costume in haute couture , some regard her as a predecessor in the American Look . [ 3 ]
#Text=West began her career spending two years designing costumes for Intolerance ( released 1916 ) in collaboration with French designer Paul Iribe . [ 4 ]
#Text=The Babylonian costumes of the film were believed to have inspired fashion trends with an April 1917 Photoplay article entitled " Back to Babylon for New Fashions " . [ 5 ]

column1: #Text=West 's impressive work led her to be given the title of " Studio Designer " at Triangle Film Corporation . [ 6 ]

column1: #Text=was believed to be the first Hollywood film to feature costumes designed for every cast member , including extras . [ 7 ]
#Text=West went straight into Griffith 's The Birth of a Nation ( 1915 ) with her designs for more cinematic Ku Klux Klan costumes inspiring the current dress of the KKK . [ 8 ]

#Text=West went into a ten film collaboration with Cecil B. DeMille where the producer/director stated " I want clothes that will make people gasp when they see them ... do n't design anything anybody could possibly buy in a store " [ 9 ]
#Text=In 1923 West was contracted to Norma Talmadge and Constance Talmadge who played the " Mountain Girl " in Intolerance . [ 10 ]
#Text=West 's final film was DeMille 's The Road to Yesterday ( 1925 ) .
#Text=West opened a dress salon in Los Angeles in 1925 which did not remain open for long .
#Text=A 1930 census listed her as a department store dress designer and living in a boarding house .
#Text=A 1940 census listed her as a designer for Patricia Perkins Inc.
#Text=West married Otis Oscar Hunley on August 24 , 1898 , had one child Maxwell Otis Hunley , then divorced in 1902 .
#Text=In 1903 West married Marshall Elmer Carriere , had three sons and divorced around 1912 .

#Text=Despite studio hype of her having studied fashion in New York and Paris there is no evidence of formal studies in either location , though DeMille sent here to Paris to research and purchase materiel for his The Ten Commandments ( 1923 ) .
#Text=In 1920 she married cinematographer Paul P. Perry but were divorced in 1922 .
#Text=West was inducted into the Costume Designers Guild Hall of Fame in 2003 .
#Text=( 1923 ) - makes cameo appearance in the film
